# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in G# (Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is when a chord is played one note at a time rather than simultaneously. The Minor 7th arpeggio in G# creates a smooth and jazzy sound, often used to add color and variety to music.

## Notes and Intervals
- G# (Root)
- B (Minor 3rd)
- D# (Perfect 5th)
- F# (Minor 7th)

## Musical Genre and Flavor
This Minor 7th arpeggio in G# is commonly heard in jazz, blues, and funk genres. It adds a soulful and melancholic flavor to the music, often creating a sense of tension that resolves beautifully.

## Songs Utilizing this Arpeggio
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This jazz classic features the Minor 7th arpeggio prominently, showcasing its versatility and emotive quality.
2. **"The Thrill is Gone" by B.B. King**: In this blues standard, the Minor 7th arpeggio in G# adds a touch of sophistication to the melancholic vibe of the song.
3. **"Chameleon" by Herbie Hancock**: This funk masterpiece incorporates the Minor 7th arpeggio in G# to create a funky and groovy sound that captivates listeners.
